Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: threadUpdate
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Update thread metadata – any attributes set in .data .threadUpdate will be used

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: threadClear
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Clear history of current thread across my devices

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: threadArchive
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Archive thread across my devices (WITHOUT leaving the distribution)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: threadRestore
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Restore/unarchive thread across my devices

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: threadDelete
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Delete the thread (leaving the distribution) across my devices

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: readMark
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Indicate to thread participants where your read-position is

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: pendingMessage
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Indicate that user is actively typing a message for the thread

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: snooze
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Stop notifications, etc. for a period. See snoozeUntil in the payload.

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: provisionRequest
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Request to assist in provisioning a new device

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: syncRequest
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Request synchronization with a device’s own peers (self devices)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: syncResponse
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Respond to .syncRequest

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: discoverRequest
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Discover threads from peers

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: discoverResponse
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Response to .discoverRequest

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: preMessageCheck
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Ask a client for any pre-messages it has for the sender

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: aclRequest
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Client prompting a bot to perform an ACL operation

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: aclResponse
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Bot responding to .aclRequest

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: userBlock
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Block a user by ID

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: userUnblock
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Unblock a user by ID

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: beacon
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Initiate contact with peers

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: closeSession
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Extended metadata for a message using the END_SESSION flag

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callJoin
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: A broadcast offer of or intent to participate in an WebRTC call

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callLeave
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: A broadcast leaving/rejecting of a WebRTC call

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callOffer
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Offering a WebRTC connection to a specific device in a call

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callAcceptOffer
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Accepting a connection offer from a specific device in a call

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callICECandidates
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Control message providing WebRTC call ICE candidates to establish a connection with a device

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.name: callHeartbeat
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ControlType.html.abstract: Indicates that a call is ongoing with the recipient, from the sender’s perspective

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ThreadType.html#.name: conversation
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ThreadType.html#.abstract: A thread where anybody can send to the group

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ThreadType.html#.name: announcement
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/ThreadType.html#.abstract: A thread where it is a broadcast

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/MessageType.html.name: content
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/MessageType.html.abstract: A content message (i.e., plain text and optional html)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Distribution.htm.name: expression
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Distribution.htm.abstract: The tag-math distribution expression for this message (required)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Attachment.html#.name: hash
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Attachment.html#.abstract: The file content hash for verifying integrity (SHA512)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Body.html#/s:14L.name: type
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/Body.html#/s:14L.abstract: Type is either text/plain or text/html (this isn’t a sensible enum because / currently gets encoded/decoded inappropriately)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: body
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Representations of the message body (plain text, html)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: control
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: The control-message type (only relevant for messages of type .control)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: readMark
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: The timestamp of the most recently read message by the sender (only relevant for .control messages of type .readMark)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: threadUpdate
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Information to update regarding this thread (only relevant for .control messages of type .threadUpdate)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: version
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Call version (only relevant in call-related .control messages)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: members
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Call members (only relevant for .control of type .callJoin)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: originator
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Call originator (only relevant for .control of type .callJoin)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: callId
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Call ID (only relevant in call-related .control messages)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: peerId
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Call peer ID (only relevant in call-related .control messages)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: sends
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Stream types the peer expects to send (only relevant in call-related .control messages)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: receives
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Stream types the peer expects to receive (only relevant in call-related .control messages)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: icecandidates
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: ICE candidates (only relevant for .control messages of type .callICECandidates)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: offer
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: SDP offer details (only relevant for .control messages of type .callOffer)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: answer
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: SDP answer details (only relevant for .control messages of type .callAcceptOffer)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: key
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: The ephemeral public key provided by a new device for provisioning (only relevant for .control messages of type .provisionRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: uuid
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Provisioning UUID, string-encoded in a form we will use as-is (only relevant for .control messages of type .provisionRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: devices
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Devices for a sync request (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: knownContacts
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Known contacts for a sync request (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: knownMessages
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Known messages for a sync request (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: knownThreads
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Known threads for a sync request (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: ttl
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: How long this is valid in milliseconds (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: type
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: What type of sync request this is (only relevant for .control messages of type .syncRequest)

Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.name: messages
Structs/ForstaPayloadV1/DataElement.html.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: unknown
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: Unknown errors should only be thrown of no other, more descriptive error type exists

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: storageError
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The local storage implementation produced an error

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: duplicateMessage
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: A message was received that was previously decrypted, or is too old

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: invalidIV
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The initialization vector has the wrong length

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: invalidLength
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The length of a message or stored object is incorrect

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: legacyMessage
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: A message from an older implementation of the protocol is received

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: noSession
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: No valid session exists for the address

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: untrustedIdentity
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The identity of the recipient is untrusted

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: invalidSignature
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The signature of the message is invalid

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: invalidProtoBuf
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: A serialized record or message is not in valid protocol buffer format

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: fPIdentityMismatch
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: The identity of two fingerprints is not equal

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: hmacError
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: There was an error calculating the HMAC of a message

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.name: digestError
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html#/s:14.abstract: There was an error calculating a digest

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: cause
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: If the error occured in a subfunction, then this variable can be used to construct an error trace.

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: file
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: The file that the error occured in

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: init(_:cause:file:function:)
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: Create a new ForstaError using an already exisiting ForstaError from a subroutine.

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: init(_:cause:file:function:)
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: Create a specific ForstaError with an Error as the annotating explanation.

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: init(_:_:file:function:)
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: Create a specific ForstaError with JSON giving details.

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: init(_:cause:file:function:)
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: Create a new ForstaError using an already exisiting Error from a subroutine.

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: description
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: A decription of the error, including all contained errors, without function and file names

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: shortDescription
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: A short decription of the error without the contained errors

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: longDescription
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: A decription of the error, including all contained errors, as well as function and file names

Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.name: json
Classes/ForstaError.html#/s:14LibForstaS.abstract: The error’s message converted to JSON (i.e., for .requestRejected), if possible

Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html.name: ErrorType
Classes/ForstaError/ErrorType.html.abstract: The different types of errors that LibForstaSwift can throw.

Classes/WebSocketResource.html#/s:14LibF.abstract: handle incoming data (responses to outgoing requests, routing to a requestHandler on incoming requests)

Classes/WebSocketResource.html#/s:14LibF.abstract: disconnect the socket and free its resources

Classes/WSRequest.html#/s:14LibForstaSwi.abstract: possible paths for endpoints on our Signal server

Classes/WSRequest.html#/s:14LibForstaSwi.abstract: construct a websocket request for our Signal server

Classes/SignalClient/AutoprovisionTask.h.name: cancel()
Classes/SignalClient/AutoprovisionTask.h.abstract: Cancel a device registration that is underway.

Classes/SignalClient/AutoprovisionTask.h.name: complete
Classes/SignalClient/AutoprovisionTask.h.abstract: A Promise<Void> that resolves when device registration is complete.

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: delegates
Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: The registered delegates for this Atlas client

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: signalAddress
Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Our full Signal address (user ID & device ID)

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: deviceLabel
Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: The public label we provided during Signal server registration for this device

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Create a new identity key and create or replace the Signal server account.

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Register a new device with an existing Signal server account.

Classes/SignalClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Upload an attachment (returns an AttachmentInfo with .id for later retrieval and .key for decryption)

Classes/SignalClient/AutoprovisionTask.h.abstract: Manage a requested autoprovision registration task for a new device

Classes/MessageSender.html#/s:14LibForst.name: send(_:to:syncToSelf:)
Classes/MessageSender.html#/s:14LibForst.abstract: Transmit a Sendable (i.e., a message) to a list of MessageRecipient

Classes/MessageSender.html#/s:14LibForst.abstract: Send a sync message of a list of SyncReadReceipt to our other devices to indicate specific messages having been read.

Classes/MessageSender/TransmissionInfo.h.abstract: Information from the Signal server about a message transmission activity

Classes/MessageReceiver.html#/s:14LibFor.name: init(signalClient:webSocketResource:)

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: source
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Device that sent the message (note that this would be one of ours if it is a sync message)

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: expiration
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Expiration of the message in seconds, if provided

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: serverAge
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: How long the message was retained by the Signal server before it was received here

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: serverReceived
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Timestamp for when the Signal server received the message (useful for correcting clock skew)

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: endSessionFlag
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Whether the end-session flag was set in the envelope

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: expirationTimerUpdateFlag
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Whether the expiration-timer-update flag was set in the envelope

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: payload
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: A ForstaPayloadV1 initialized with the the inbound message’s envelope body

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: attachments
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Information about any associated attachments – use SignalClient.fetchAttachment() to retrieve and decrypt them

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: expirationStart
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: Expiration start-time (if there was an expiration and this is a sync message from another of our devices)

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: destination
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: The destination set in the sync message container (in Forsta, this is usually the threadId for the message)

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: signalBody
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: The Signal envelope body you shouldn’t need to look at directly

Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.name: description
Classes/InboundMessage.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: human-readable string to get the gist of this InboundMessage

Classes/AttachmentInfo.html#/s:14LibFors.name: id
Classes/AttachmentInfo.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: The storage id used to download the encrypted file contents

Classes/AttachmentInfo.html#/s:14LibFors.name: key
Classes/AttachmentInfo.html#/s:14LibFors.abstract: The key used to encrypt the file contents before upload

Classes/DeliveryReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.name: address
Classes/DeliveryReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.abstract: the device that retrieved a message we sent from the Signal server

Classes/DeliveryReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.name: timestamp
Classes/DeliveryReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.abstract: the timestamp of the sent message (used to identify messages in Signal)

Classes/SyncReadReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.name: timestamp
Classes/SyncReadReceipt.html#/s:14LibFor.abstract: the read-message’s timestamp (used to identify messages in Signal)

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: workQueue
Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: The DispatchQueue that LibForstaSwift will do any asyncronous internal work on (Serial, QoS of Utility)

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: bgQueue
Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: The DispatchQueue that LibForstaSwift will do any background, concurrent asyncronous internal work on (Concurrent, QoS of Background)

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: An Atlas client for Forsta Atlas server operations.

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: signal
Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: A Signal client for Forsta Signal server operations.

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Connect the Signal server web socket for messaging.

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.name: send(_:to:syncToSelf:)
Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Transmit a Sendable (i.e., a message) to a list of MessageRecipient

Classes/ForstaClient.html#/s:14LibForsta.abstract: Send a sync message of a list of SyncReadReceipt to our other devices to indicate specific messages having been read.

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: trimmed
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: superficial lexical adjustments (.lex source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: ignored
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: serious lexical adjustments that could be surprising (.lex source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: implicitUnion
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: random text understood as a union operator (.parse source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: unexpected
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: unexpected item(s) necessitating recovery-guesses (.parse source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: unbalanced
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: unbalanced parens necessitating recovery-guesses (.parse source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: unrecognized
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: unknown tag (.eval source)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: lex
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: a lexical warning (like extra text that is being ignored)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: parse
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: a parsing warning (like noting an implicit union or unbalanced parens)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: eval
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: a parsing warning (like noting an unrecognized tag)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: source
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: the general category of this warning

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: Source
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: general categories that the kinds of warnings fall into

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: kind
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: the kind of this warning

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: Kind
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: various kinds of tag-math resolution warnings

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: cue
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: a hint to show to a user (usually an offending snippet of the input)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: position
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: offset into the original input of the warning

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: length
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: length of the text in the original input causing the warning

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: pretty
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The pretty version of this evaluated expression (simplified, human-readable with slug strings, qualified for the evaluating user’s organization)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: universal
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The universal version of this evaluated expression (simplified, uses absolute tag IDs rather than slug strings)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: users
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The users this expression resolves to

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: monitors
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The monitors that were included in the resolution

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: includedTags
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The tags which were positively used in the expression (i.e., added)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: excludedTags
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: The tags which were negatively used in the expression (i.e., subtracted)

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: warnings
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: Warnings about lexing, parsing, or evaluation issues

Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.name: Warning
Classes/AtlasClient/TagExpressionResolut.abstract: Warning about tag-math resolution

Classes/AtlasClient/SignalAccountInfo.ht.abstract: The server URL to use for Signal requests
